body.p: The <sqf:user-entry> element defines a value that must be set manually by the user. If multiple user-entry elements are defined, will display a dialog box for each one, in which the user can specify values. Also, the <user-entry> element can be used as an XPath variable where the XPath variable is the name of the user-entry.

p.codeblock: <sqf:fix id="duplicate"> <sqf:description> <sqf:title>Change the name of the element</sqf:title> </sqf:description> <sqf:user-entry name="newName" default="product"> <sqf:description> <sqf:title>Enter the new name of the element</sqf:title> </sqf:description> </sqf:user-entry> <sqf:replace node-type="element" target="{$newName}" select="child::node()"/> </sqf:fix>
